00354         // -------------------------------------------------------------
00355         //  Iterator inner-class
00356         // -------------------------------------------------------------
00357         class Iterator
00358         {
00359           public:
00360             Iterator(Node** data, unsigned int position, unsigned int arraySize)
00361             {
00362               myArraySize = arraySize;
00363               myContainerData = data;
00364               myNode = data[0];
00365               myCurrentCell = position;
00366               while ((!myNode) && (myCurrentCell < myArraySize))
00367               {
00368                 myNode = myContainerData[++myCurrentCell];
00369               }
00370             }
00371             bool isAtEnd()const
00372             {
00373               return myCurrentCell >= myArraySize;
00374             }
00375             ValueType& operator*()
00376             {
00377               return myNode->getObject();
00378             }
00379             bool operator ++ ()
00380             {
00381               return next();
00382             }
00383             bool operator == (const Iterator& it)
00384             {
00385               if (isAtEnd() && it.isAtEnd())
00386                 return true;
00387               else
00388                 return (myNode == it.myNode);
00389             }
00390             bool operator != (const Iterator& it)
00391             {
00392               if (isAtEnd() && it.isAtEnd())
00393                 return false;
00394               else
00395                 return (myNode != it.myNode);
00396             }
00397             inline HashKey getKey() const
00398             {
00399               return myNode->getKey();
00400             }
00401             bool next();
00402           protected:
00403             Node* myNode;
00404             unsigned int myCurrentCell;
00405             unsigned int myArraySize;
00406             Node** myContainerData;
00407         };
00408

00422           return Iterator(myData, myArraySize, myArraySize);

00517         template <int X, unsigned int exponent> struct POW
00518         {
00519           enum { VALUE = X * POW < X, exponent - 1 >::VALUE};
00520         };
00521         template <int X > struct POW<X, 1>
00522         {
00523           enum { VALUE = X };
00524         };

00531         inline HashKey getIntermediateKey(const HashKey key) const;
00532 
00533 
00538         Node* addNode(const ValueType object, const HashKey key)
00539         {
00540           Node* n = getNode(key);
00541           if (n)
00542           {
00543             n->getObject() = object;
00544             //n->setObject(object);
00545             return n;
00546           }
00547           n = new Node(object, key);
00548           HashKey key2 = getIntermediateKey(key);
00549           n->setNext(myData[key2]);
00550           myData[key2] = n;
00551           return n;
00552         }
00553 
00559         inline Node* getNode(const HashKey key) const   // very used !!
00560         {
00561           Node* iter = myData[getIntermediateKey(key)];
00562           while (iter != 0)
00563           {
00564             if (iter->getKey() == key)
00565               return iter;
00566             iter = iter->getNext();
00567           }
00568           return 0;
00569         }
